messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] SARAH!...
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/16/2001 3:31:44 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ... Pam, You are a absolute delight and I think quite a light all on your own. I eagerly open
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/16/2001 3:31:44 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
pamhartley@... writes:


> Where is that poster I grumbled at yesterday for lecturing all of us on
> growing up? I might have been too hasty in my cantankerosity.
>
>

Pam,

You are a absolute delight and I think quite a "light" all on your own. I
eagerly open your mail when I see it, knowing I will probably have either a
laugh or an Ah-ha. . . thanks girlfriend.

lovemary


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: SARAH!...
messages.msgSnippet: ...sorry, the SANDRA! in your other post brings out the devilish in me. You can now post to PAM! if you like. And please don t use the word we as you ve
messages.messageBody:
...sorry, the "SANDRA!" in your other post brings out the devilish in me.
You can now post to PAM! if you like.

And please don't use the word "we" as you've used it in the post below. You
can speak for yourself, not everyone here.

Personally, I'm glad when anyone, whether their name happens to be Sandra,
turns on lights for me. I am pretty sure that Sandra is grateful when people
turn on lights for her, too.

Where is that poster I grumbled at yesterday for lecturing all of us on
growing up? I might have been too hasty in my cantankerosity.

Pam, part of "we"
----------
>From: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
>To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1480
>Date: Sun, Sep 16, 2001, 9:52 AM
>

> <I'm trying to
> turn the lights on in a place in which people seem to be hoping they can
wish
> away human instinct and manifest human nature.
>
> Sandra
> >>>>>>>>>
> I don't think we need you to turn on any lights for us, Sandra. Please
> let people have their opinions and feelings without having to constantly
> criticize them or "correct" them.
> Sarah
